summary: An email chain forwarded by attorney Stacey Richman, containing a forwarded message from Mark L. Epstein to her, which itself contains a threatening email sent to Epstein from an alias 'Puggie'. The threat demands Epstein tell the court he partnered with his brother or his family will be killed.

connections.description: Mark L. Epstein forwarded a threatening email to his attorney, Stacey Richman, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Puggie sent a direct threat to Mark L. Epstein, demanding action in court under threat of violence against Epstein's family.

events.title: Threatening Email Sent to Mark L. Epstein
events.description: An individual using the alias 'Puggie' sent an email to Mark L. Epstein threatening to kill his family if he does not tell the court he partnered with his brother.

events.title: Email Forwarded to Attorney
events.description: Mark L. Epstein forwarded the threatening email to his attorney, Stacey Richman, who then forwarded it with her confidentiality notice.

keyFacts: Mark L. Epstein received a direct death threat via email on May 25, 2020, demanding he make a specific statement to a court.
The threat, from 'Puggie', explicitly states 'we kill your family like your brother', implying a prior violent incident involving Epstein's brother.
The threat is connected to a court proceeding, demanding Epstein state he 'partnered with your brother'.
Attorney Stacey Richman received and forwarded the threatening email chain, indicating it was brought to legal attention.
